instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00291: What is 820-00291? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5_LDO: What is PP5V_S5_LDO? PP5V_S5_LDO is a 5v rail present when the machine is in a S5 soft off state. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: iMac (Retina 5K, 27-inch, Late 2015) Yes/No?
threads.message:
Good Day Guys, im not sure if ill be able to get some assistance on this iMac problem but here goes nothing.

I have a 5k 27inch iMac that does not want to power on. The PSU is good (tested on another imac) and the diagnostic LED's are all off. Anyone have any idea where i can start looking? ;)

threads.title: iMac (Retina 5K, 27-inch, Late 2015) Yes/No?
threads.message:
I guess is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00291</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, so no schematic available, have one here with same symptoms, the problem here was because a shorted USB port(dead TPS2561), 5V rail shorted (dead <CHIP>ISL62383</CHIP>), burnt CPU Vcore rail (dead <CHIP>ISL95828</CHIP>)..

All parts replaced and no improvement, no schematic so i cant go furter.....

12v present
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL> present
3.42V present
3.3V S5 no present...

threads.title: iMac (Retina 5K, 27-inch, Late 2015) Yes/No?
threads.message: First would be to check for obvious shorts. The first LED is usually powered from <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> so it may be very simple issue.

threads.title: iMac (Retina 5K, 27-inch, Late 2015) Yes/No?
threads.message: I have the same problem, however, my iMac show the caps lock light and make the noise when turning on but the display does not show anything, anyone has a solution?
